reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: 1. Project: 11526 Uganda Office PMER Support for the MFA frame Funded Programme#2. Project area and Country: Uganda #3. Project justification: #Field presence is essential to be able to improve programme reach and quality. Working with local partners requi res close cooperation and working hand in hand through the project cycle. The field presence is in line with FCAs strategy, and supports the strategic goals related to programme development and quality, capacity building, advocacy, thematic/technical suppo rt and broadening the funding base. FCA presence in Uganda has helped demonstrate FCAs added-value by building the capacity of local partners, including strategic government departments. This strategy will also enhance the sustainability of FCA interventio ns once the programme eventually phases out.#4. The main objective and expected results:#The main objective is to improve the effectiveness, quality and impact of the FCA country programme focusing on the thematic areas Right to Livelihood, Right to Qualit y Education and Right to Peace through established field presence. This will be achieved through strategic and operational planning for the country programme, planning and monitoring of the Country Programme and related projects and capacity building of lo cal partners. The focus is on active networking at country level, broadening the access to funding opportunities, coordination of work and cooperation with other aid organisations, as well as ensuring increased input of partner organisations from the regio n into the lobby and advocacy work. The above activities will lead to improved programme delivery by the implementing partners, quality reporting and financial management, as well as increased visibility of FCA and MFAs supported work in Uganda. Additional ly, the activities will improve accountability and trust by the host government of FCAs work and programme in Uganda.#5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries/Duty bearers: FCA Uganda country office staff, as well as local partners staff, women groups and youth.#6. Partners: Local and regional civil society actors, international organisations, donors
